solution_line_template: The total amount of money collected from the boy's payment is {num_boys}*${boy_payment} = $<<{num_boys}*{boy_payment}={total_boy_payment}>>{total_boy_payment}
There are four times as many boys at Lulu's party as girls, meaning there are {num_boys}/{boys_to_girls_ratio} = <<{num_boys}/{boys_to_girls_ratio}={num_girls}>>{num_girls} girls at the party.

since each boy paid twice the money that each girl paid to attend the party, each girl paid ${boy_payment}/{boy_girl_payment_ratio} = $<<{boy_payment}/{boy_girl_payment_ratio}={girl_payment}>>{girl_payment}
The total amount of money collected from the girl's payment is ${girl_payment}*{num_girls} = $<<{girl_payment}*{num_girls}={total_girl_payment}>>{total_girl_payment}
The total amount of money collected at the party is ${total_girl_payment}+${total_boy_payment} = $<<{total_girl_payment}+{total_boy_payment}={total_money_collected}>>{total_money_collected}
